issue.title: Allow customization of chat_input keybindings for newline and send actions

labels.name: type:enhancement
labels.description: Requests for feature enhancements or new features

labels.name: status:unlikely
labels.description: Will probably not implement but looking for further feedback

issue.body:
### Checklist

- [X] I have searched the [existing issues](https://github.com/streamlit/streamlit/issues) for similar feature requests.
- [X] I added a descriptive title and summary to this issue.

### Summary

I would like to request a feature to allow customization of the keybindings for newline and send actions in chat_input, as the current default (Enter to send, Shift+Enter to create a newline) is prone to accidental submissions.

### Why?

The current default keybindings in chat_input can lead to accidental submissions when users intend to create a newline. Allowing customization of these keybindings would improve the user experience and reduce the risk of unintended message sending.

### How?

Introduce two optional parameters to the st.chat_input function: send_key and newline_key. These parameters would allow users to specify the keys for the 'send' and 'newline' actions, respectively. The default values would remain as 'Enter' for send_key and 'Shift+Enter' for newline_key to maintain backward compatibility.


st.chat_input(placeholder="Your message", send_key='Enter', newline_key='Shift+Enter')

### Additional Context

This feature request was prompted by a user who experienced difficulties with the current keybindings, as they found them prone to accidental message sending. Allowing customization of these keybindings would enhance the usability of chat_input for a wider range of users.

comment.body: In my web app implemented with streamlit, it is essential to have a newline input. In PC environment, you can use shift + enter, but it is not possible to use newline on mobile. In the ChatGPT mobile app, enter is used to break lines, and the input is sent through the send button next to it. Please support the same feature in st.chat_input as in the chatGPT mobile app.

issue.title: st.column skips code between column initialization and its usage

labels.name: status:needs-triage
labels.description: Has not been triaged by the Streamlit team

issue.body:
### Checklist

- [X] I have searched the [existing issues](https://github.com/streamlit/streamlit/issues) for similar issues.
- [X] I added a very descriptive title to this issue.
- [X] I have provided sufficient information below to help reproduce this issue.

### Summary

Any code written between `st.columns()` and its usage by using `with` is ignored.
The code is not skipped if we don't add anything to the column using `with`.

### Reproducible Code Example

```Python
import streamlit as st

col1, col2 = st.columns(2)
st.write("Supposed be displayed as first line.")
with col1:
	st.write("Inside col1")
with col2:
	st.write("Inside col2")
```


### Steps To Reproduce

Run the streamlit code above.

### Expected Behavior

The first line should be printed as "Supposed be displayed as first line."

### Current Behavior

The line "Supposed be displayed as first line." is displayed below the data printed in columns.

### Is this a regression?

- [ ] Yes, this used to work in a previous version.

### Debug info

- Streamlit version: 1.27.2
- Python version: 3.9.16
- Operating System: Ubuntu 22.04.3 LTS (64-bit)
- Browser: Microsoft Edge (Version 115.0.1901.203 (Official build) (64-bit))

### Additional Information

_No response_

comment.body:
**If this issue affects you, please react with a 👍 (thumbs up emoji) to the initial post.**

Your feedback helps us prioritize which bugs to investigate and address first.

pull_request.title: Add ip info into UserProxy & add access log
pull_request.body:
<!--
Before contributing (PLEASE READ!)

⚠️ If your contribution is more than a few lines of code, then prior to starting to code on it please post in the issue saying you want to volunteer, then wait for a positive response. And if there is no issue for it yet, create it first.

This helps make sure:

  1. Two people aren't working on the same thing
  2. This is something Streamlit's maintainers believe should be implemented/fixed
  3. Any API, UI, or deeper architectural changes that need to be implemented have been fully thought through by Streamlit's maintainers
  4. Your time is well spent!

More information in our wiki: https://github.com/streamlit/streamlit/wiki/Contributing
-->

## 📚 Context

Restart #6214

logging who and where access streamlit app **pages** if it is deployed behind a self controled reverse authentication proxy. eg `Oauth2-proxy`

Since streamlit use websocket to switch between pages, logging just by nginx is impossible. We have to log it in streamlit.

So I add IP infomation into `UserProxy` and  log them in rerun.

And I also add support for get `current user` in self hosted condition, not limited to cloud anymore.

- What kind of change does this PR introduce?

  - [ ] Bugfix
  - [x] Feature
  - [ ] Refactoring
  - [ ] Other, please describe:

## 🧠 Description of Changes

- _Add bullet points summarizing your changes here_

  - [ ] This is a breaking API change
  - [ ] This is a visible (user-facing) change

**Revised:**

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/8296331/222655084-74365b66-e2ff-43c1-b4d4-ea6e68141bb7.png)


**Current:**

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/8296331/222655197-02cea6f9-4b9a-4f0e-9157-d85d47b939aa.png)

## 🧪 Testing Done

- [x] Screenshots included
- [ ] Added/Updated unit tests
- [ ] Added/Updated e2e tests

## 🌐 References

_Does this depend on other work, documents, or tickets?_

- **Issue**: Closes https://github.com/streamlit/streamlit/issues/602

---

**Contribution License Agreement**

By submitting this pull request you agree that all contributions to this project are made under the Apache 2.0 license.

issue.title: Missing session_state when jump page

labels.name: status:needs-triage
labels.description: Has not been triaged by the Streamlit team

issue.body: ### Checklist - [X] I have searched the [existing issues](https://github.com/streamlit/streamlit/issues) for similar issues. - [X] I added a very descriptive title to this issue. - [X] I have provided sufficient information below to help reproduce this issue. ### Summary I need to perform cross service login verification, but the code won't work and the session will be lost。 ### Reproducible Code Example ```Python import streamlit as st import requests auth_url = 'http://172.18.50.44:30650/api/check.do' def check_auth_status(): ''' check auth status :param st: streamlit :return: 0. no login 1. login success 2. login failed 3. already login ''' def check_sso(): query_params = st.experimental_get_query_params() userid = query_params["userid"] response = requests.post(auth_url, data={"userid": userid}) if response.status_code == 200: result = response.json() if result["code"] == '0': print(f"user {userid} login success, {result}") st.session_state.user = userid return 1 else: print(f"user {userid} login failed, {result}") else: print(f"request auth server failed, {response.status_code}") if "user" in st.session_state: del st.session_state.user return 2 if 'userid' in st.experimental_get_query_params(): return check_sso() elif "user" in st.session_state: return 3 else: return 0 login_status = check_auth_status() if login_status == 0 or login_status == 2: st.error("forbidden") st.stop() elif login_status == 1: # st.markdown('[success](/?login=true)') # st.markdown('success', unsafe_allow_html=True) st.write('', unsafe_allow_html=True) else: st.success("login success") ``` ### Steps To Reproduce _No response_ ### Expected Behavior _No response_ ### Current Behavior _No response_ ### Is this a regression? - [ ] Yes, this used to work in a previous version. ### Debug info - Streamlit version: 1.27.2 - Python version: 3.10.11 - Operating System: ubuntu 22.04 - Browser: Microsoft Edge 112.0.1722.39, Google Chrome 118.0.5993.72 ### Additional Information _No response_

comment.body: I has logged in, but click 'success' return forbidden
